intro: Jacquinia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican heath, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, often in mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it blooms in the spring. Jacquinia mexicana is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
